description: Variation of condition 7 (Code for Sustainable Homes) of outline planning permission ref: PP/2011/4250 dated 08/03/2013 for Development of site to provide a part four (4), part ten (10), part twelve (12), part fourteen (14), part eighteen-storey (18) building, plus basement, comprising 673 square metres of commercial floor space for flexible use for shops (within Use Class A1), Financial and Professional Services (Use Class A2), Restaurants and Cafes (Use Class A3), Hot Food Takeaway (Use Class A5), Business (Use Class B1) or non-residential Institution (Use Class D1) and 151 residential units above (83 x 1-bedroom, 65 x 2-bedroom and 3 x 3 bedroom flats); together with alterations to the existing access and provision of 30 car parking spaces (15 to a disabled standard) and 169 cycle storage spaces at basement level (Outline Planning Application -  Access, Layout and Scale being sought and Appearance and Landscaping matters to be reserved): variation to remove submission of interim certificate prior to commencement of works.
decision_conditions: Prior to commencement of each phase of development that includes residential units evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and a CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment for that phase is submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information demonstrating measures that will be incorporated into that phase to ensure that all residential units of that phase have been designed to achieve at least Level 4 of the Code for sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guidance). Within 3 months of the commencement of each phase of the development, CfSH Interim Design Stage Certificates verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. No residential dwelling within that phase shall be occupied in the development until CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures will be achieved. Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented. Such measures shall be retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured; in accordance with policy 5.3 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 1.2 & 3.4 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
